fields.summary: Imagingbackend NOTREADY after installing service image

comments.body: [~shaon] imaging service configuration was changed in 4.2. Do you have enabled cloudformation service?

Yes, {{cloudformation}} service is enabled.

{noformat}
[root@e-18 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep imaging
SERVICE	imaging           	API_10.111.1.127	API_10.111.1.127.imaging	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.111.1.127:8773/services/Imaging	arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.1.127:imaging:API_10.111.1.127.imaging/
SERVICE	imagingbackend    	eucalyptus	10.111.1.127         	NOTREADY	32  	http://10.111.1.127:8773/services/ImagingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::imagingbackend:10.111.1.127/
[root@e-18 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep cloudformation
SERVICE	cloudformation    	API_10.111.1.127	API_10.111.1.127.cloudformation	ENABLED 	32  	http://10.111.1.127:8773/services/CloudFormation	arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.1.127:cloudformation:API_10.111.1.127.cloudformation/
{noformat}

[~vasya], [~shaon]
Hmmm...I'm running into this problem too.  I recently upgraded to the latest 4.2 eucalyptus version and now Imagingbackend shows NOTREADY.  Here's what I'm seeing:
{code}
[root@g-19-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep imaging
SERVICE imaging                 API_10.111.1.135        API_10.111.1.135.imaging        ENABLED         31      http://10.111.1.135:8773/services/Imaging     arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.1.135:imaging:API_10.111.1.135.imaging/
SERVICE imagingbackend          eucalyptus      10.111.1.135            NOTREADY        31      http://10.111.1.135:8773/services/ImagingBackend        arn:euca:eucalyptus::imagingbackend:10.111.1.135/
[root@g-19-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep cloudformation
SERVICE cloudformation          API_10.111.1.135        API_10.111.1.135.cloudformation ENABLED         31      http://10.111.1.135:8773/services/CloudFormation       arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.1.135:cloudformation:API_10.111.1.135.cloudformation/
{code}

Package Versions:
{code}
[root@g-19-11 ~]# rpm -qa | grep euca
eucalyptus-admin-tools-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
eucanetd-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-axis2c-common-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sc-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cc-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
eucaconsole-4.1.1-0.0.6279.407.20150601gitbd0064f.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-service-image-1.21-0.49.42.150527git66135cf.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-blockdev-utils-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-walrus-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
euca2ools-3.2.0-0.0.1691.26.20150529git506f521.el6.noarch
{code}

euca properties:
{code}
[root@g-19-11 ~]# euca-describe-properties services.imag
PROPERTY        services.imaging.import_task_expiration_hours   168
PROPERTY        services.imaging.import_task_timeout_minutes    180
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.availability_zones      {}
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.configured      true
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.expiration_days 180
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.healthcheck     true
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.image   emi-0a99fce4
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.init_script     {}
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.instance_type   m1.small
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.keyname casey-ubu
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.log_server      {}
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.log_server_port 514
PROPERTY        services.imaging.worker.ntp_server      {}
{code}

I checked the logs but I don't see any repeating errors related to this.
[~ccassler], upgrade from 4.1 to 4.2 requires extra steps. You can't just upgrade package with yum and have service operational.

This issue is not fixed. I tried with latest packages on a freshly installed cloud:

{code}
eucalyptus-service-image-1.21-0.49.42.150527git66135cf.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.x86_64
{code}

More details on when the packages were built, just to make sure I have got the fixes in them:

{code}
# rpm -qi eucalyptus-cloud
Name        : eucalyptus-cloud             Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.2.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6   Build Date: Mon 01 Jun 2015 05:04:10 PM PDT
Install Date: Tue 02 Jun 2015 04:42:52 AM PDT      Build Host: euca-10-111-54-111
Group       : Applications/System           Source RPM: eucalyptus-4.2.0-0.0.23375.483.20150601gitd0072eb.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 29210                            License: GPLv3
Signature   : (none)
URL         : http://www.eucalyptus.com
Summary     : Eucalyptus cloud platform - cloud controller
Description :
Eucalyptus is a service overlay that implements elastic computing
using existing resources. The goal of Eucalyptus is to allow sites
with existing clusters and server infrastructure to co-host an elastic
computing service that is interface-compatible with Amazon AWS.

This package contains the cloud controller part of eucalyptus. The cloud
controller needs to be reachable by both the cluster controller and from
the cloud clients.
{code}

Then install the image:

{code}
# esi-install-image --install-default
Installing Service Image...
Found tarball /usr/share/eucalyptus/service-images/eucalyptus-service-image.tgz
Decompressing tarball: /usr/share/eucalyptus/service-images/eucalyptus-service-image.tgz
Bundling, uploading and registering image to bucket: eucalyptus-service-image-1.21
Registered image: emi-2235b92e
PROPERTY	services.imaging.worker.image	emi-2235b92e was NULL
PROPERTY	services.loadbalancing.worker.image	emi-2235b92e was NULL
PROPERTY	services.database.worker.image	emi-2235b92e was NULL
{code}

But imagingbackend is still showing as NOTREADY

{code}
SERVICE	imagingbackend    	eucalyptus	10.104.10.1          	NOTREADY	30  	http://10.104.10.1:8773/services/ImagingBackend	arn:euca:eucalyptus::imagingbackend:10.104.10.1/

SERVICE	cloudformation    	API_4     	API_4.cloudformation 	ENABLED 	30  	http://10.104.10.4:8773/services/CloudFormation	arn:euca:bootstrap:API_4:cloudformation:API_4.cloudformation/
{code}

My setup UFS is not on CLC.

[~vasya]: I used calyptos (euca-deploy) to upgrade this cloud so that should've been covered.  I used the same method to upgrade the shared cloud and it worked fine.  Hmmm...I think I do remember starting from scratch installing 4.2.0 on the shared setup instead of upgrading so perhaps something slipped through the cracks using euca-deploy.

I can  confirm after I run esi-manage-stack -a create imaging the service
transition into ENABLED state. Cheers!

Cheers,
Deependra

On Wed, Jun 3, 2015 at 10:27 AM, Vasiliy Kochergin (JIRA) <
Looks like the issue is gone with a fix from EUCA-11336
Not seeing this issue anymore in recent builds.
